subject: Re: [junit] New Classes when refactoring
msgSnippet: ... Both.  Your original tests should still work, so keep them.  But you may also wish to create new tests for specific pieces of the new class. Cheers, Kevin
messageBody:
"Cox, Randy" wrote:
I picked Refactoring - Martin Fowler up at Java One.  The question I have
is:  When you add new class during refactoring, perhaps adding a "value
object" or  "replacing conditional logic with polymorphism" do you test it
through your original JUnit Tests or do you build a new Test class for the
new class.
Both.  Your original tests should still work, so keep them.  But you may also wish to create new tests for specific pieces of the new class.

Cheers,
    Kevin
